member.name: IMFContentEnabler.AutomaticEnable
member.summary: Performs a content enabling action without any user interaction.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFContentEnabler.Cancel
member.summary: Cancels a pending content enabling action.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFContentEnabler.GetEnableData
member.summary: Retrieves the data for a manual content enabling action.
member.param: Receives a pointer to a buffer that contains the data. The caller must free the buffer by calling .
Receives the size of the ppbData buffer.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFContentEnabler.GetEnableType
member.summary: Retrieves the type of operation that this content enabler performs.
member.param: Receives a GUID that identifies the type of operation. An application can tailor its user interface (UI) strings for known operation types. See Remarks.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFContentEnabler.GetEnableURL
member.summary: Retrieves a URL for performing a manual content enabling action.
member.param: Receives a pointer to a buffer that contains the URL. The caller must release the memory for the buffer by calling .
Receives the number of characters returned in ppwszURL, including the terminating NULL character.
Receives a member of the enumeration indicating whether the URL is trusted.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFContentEnabler.IsAutomaticSupported
member.summary: Queries whether the content enabler can perform all of its actions automatically.
member.param: Receives a Boolean value. If TRUE, the content enabler can perform the enabling action automatically.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

member.name: IMFContentEnabler.MonitorEnable
member.summary: Requests notification when the enabling action is completed.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

listheader.description: The method succeeded and no action was required.

member.name: IMFContentEnabler
member.summary: Implements one step that must be performed for the user to access media content. For example, the steps might be individualization followed by license acquisition. Each of these steps would be encapsulated by a content enabler object that exposes the IMFContentEnabler interface.
